instructions: At a certain university in the U.S., all phone numbers are 7-digits long and start with either 824 or 825.
question:
(b)

How many different phone numbers are there in which the last four digits are all different?
answer: There are two choices for the first three digits (824 or 825). In selecting the remaining 4 digits, 4 digits are selected from a set of 10 with no repetitions, so there are P(10, 4) choices. The total number of 7-digit phone numbers that start with 824 or 825 and have no repeated digits among the last four digits is 2·P(10, 4).
